oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Glimpses of Nashville, Tennessee: The Parthenon
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A view of the Parthenon at Centennial Park, Nashville, Tennessee, circa 1904. The Parthenon, located in Centennial Park, is a reproduction of the Greek Athenian Temple. This full scale replica was originally constructed out of wood, plaster and brick as a temporary exhibit for the Tennessee Centennial Exposition in 1897. A permanent version of Parthenon was constructed out of concrete in 1921-1931 to replace the one built for the exposition. The Nashville Parthenon underwent major renovations in 1991-2001. It now serves as a museum and art gallery and was added to the National Register of Historic Places in 1972. Forms part of Glimpses of Nashville. 1 booklet
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Parthenon (Art museum : Nashville, Tenn.)
